        getName in class ViewManager<com.facebook.react.views.switchview.ReactSwitch,LayoutShadowNode>
        Returns:
        the name of this view manager. This will be the name used to reference this view manager from JavaScript in createReactNativeComponentClass.

      • createShadowNodeInstance

        public LayoutShadowNode createShadowNodeInstance()
        Description copied from class: ViewManager
        This method should return a subclass of ReactShadowNode which will be then used for measuring position and size of the view. In most of the cases this should just return an instance of ReactShadowNode
        Overrides:
        createShadowNodeInstance in class SimpleViewManager<com.facebook.react.views.switchview.ReactSwitch>

      • getShadowNodeClass

        public java.lang.Class getShadowNodeClass()
        Description copied from class: ViewManager
        This method should return Class instance that represent type of shadow node that this manager will return from ViewManager.createShadowNodeInstance().

        This method will be used in the bridge initialization phase to collect properties exposed using ReactProp (or ReactPropGroup) annotation from the ReactShadowNode subclass specific for native view this manager provides.

        Overrides:
        getShadowNodeClass in class SimpleViewManager<com.facebook.react.views.switchview.ReactSwitch>
        Returns:
        Class object that represents type of shadow node used by this view manager.

      • receiveCommand

        public void receiveCommand(com.facebook.react.views.switchview.ReactSwitch view,
                           java.lang.String commandId,
                           ReadableArray args)
        Description copied from class: ViewManager
        Subclasses may use this method to receive events/commands directly from JS through the UIManager. Good example of such a command would be scrollTo request with coordinates for a ReactScrollView instance.
        Overrides:
        receiveCommand in class ViewManager<com.facebook.react.views.switchview.ReactSwitch,LayoutShadowNode>
        Parameters:
        view - View instance that should receive the command
        commandId - code of the command
        args - optional arguments for the command

      • addEventEmitters

        protected void addEventEmitters(ThemedReactContext reactContext,
                                com.facebook.react.views.switchview.ReactSwitch view)
        Description copied from class: ViewManager
        Subclasses can override this method to install custom event emitters on the given View. You might want to override this method if your view needs to emit events besides basic touch events to JS (e.g. scroll events).
        Overrides:
        addEventEmitters in class ViewManager<com.facebook.react.views.switchview.ReactSwitch,LayoutShadowNode>

      • getDelegate

        protected ViewManagerDelegate<com.facebook.react.views.switchview.ReactSwitch> getDelegate()
        Description copied from class: ViewManager
        Override this method and return an instance of ViewManagerDelegate if the props of the view managed by this view manager should be set via this delegate. The provided instance will then get calls to ViewManagerDelegate.setProperty(View, String, Object) for every prop that must be updated and it's the delegate's responsibility to apply these values to the view.

        By default this method returns null, which means that the view manager doesn't have a delegate and the view props should be set internally by the view manager itself.

        Overrides:
        getDelegate in class ViewManager<com.facebook.react.views.switchview.ReactSwitch,LayoutShadowNode>
        Returns:
        an instance of ViewManagerDelegate if the props of the view managed by this view manager should be set via this delegate
